instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin and stop loop
threads.message:
Hello

I m working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board. Its came service for topcase replacemen and workingt but now not turning on. Fan spins then stop loop.


When checked voltages <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> enable signal turning on and off, its come from SMC but i cant be sure why SMC defect suddenly. My brain burned any idea for start to check?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.5V and stable
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> = 12.5V and stable
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.43V and stable
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5V and stable
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3V and stable

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin and stop loop
threads.message: The most likely is of course damage to the board,  knocked off component. Long screw damage or something like that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin and stop loop
threads.message:
You are definitely right duke but checked under microscope few times but cant find anything. Maybe voltage fallow in schematic can help me find problem :(  
When connected power supply from magsafe connector with connector take 0.23A then 0.01 and again 0.23A loop.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin and stop loop
threads.message:
Thank you [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] after you message checked every connector and found USB line defected and few component missing at I/O board. But when i didnt connect J9500 connector continue same issue.
So question is ; Could be damage <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> (PCH) from USB data line, and my board problem is could be PCH ? Do you think i have to replace PCH ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin and stop loop
threads.message: I doubt it. But the fact that damage was done somewhere makes it likely there is other damage present. There is no systematic solution to this. Any missing resistor can cause this behavior. Inspect better for damage.
